notesStmt.note: The wedding took place on the Fourth day [Wed.] of the week, 29th of Ḥeshṿan, 5634 [19 Nov. 1873] in the city of Bukhara. The groom is Mashiaḥ ben Ḥayim ben Yitsḥaḳ Menaḥem. The bride is Malkah bat m.ṿ. Ḥayim ben m.ṿ. Mashiaḥ. Signatures: Mar Magzum Naśi ben Mar Yitsḥaḳ, witness; ha-tsaʻir Matituhu ben Mosheh, witness; tsaʻir Daṿid b.k.R. Eliyahu Raḥamim mi-bet Shoḥeṭ Bavli, S.ṭ.

msIdentifier.repository: Library at the Herbert D. Katz Center for Advanced Judaic Studies

msContents.summary: Manuscript ketubah with standard ketubah text in black ink in Aramaic and Hebrew in Sephardic semi-cursive script. Terms of the dowry and bride price in Judeo-Tajik. Leaf sides have straight edges save for the top which is tapered. Verses from Scripture in block Hebrew print with gouache surround the ketubah text: Psalms 128 and Isaiah 61:10 in outside border; Isaiah 62:5 straight across the top. There are two roundels at the top: outside of right roundel has abridged verse from Malachi (3:20) and Proverbs 5:18 in the center; outside of left roundel has abridged verse from Isaiah (30:26) and Proverbs 18:22 in the center. Between the two roundels are words of blessing to the bride and groom in Aramaic and Hebrew which are framed by words of the abridged sixth blessing recited at a Jewish wedding. Wedding took place on 29 Ḥeshṿan 5634 (19 Nov. 1873), in Bukhara, Uzbekistan. With the unusual presence of three signatures. The third is presumed to be the scribe.
